Give yourself the gift of clear vision– schedule an appointment with Tracey L. Mercer, OD today.

Located in Birmingham, Ala., Michael A. Callahan, M.D. and Associates P.C. offers a suite of eyecare services to the residents of the surrounding areas. Begun about 50 years ago, its team of 4 physicians and surgeons provide an array of specialty and routine eyecare services, including general eye exams, treatment of eye injuries, diabetic eyecare, glaucoma treatment, dry eyes and Blepharitis. In addition, Michael A. Callahan, M.D. and Associates P.C. also specializes in no-stitch cataract surgery, prescription of contact lenses/eyeglasses and reconstructive and cosmetic procedures.

Dr. Susan H. Eiland, M.D., PC specializes in ophthalmology, the medical and surgical treatment of the eye and eye diseases. We perform a comprehensive set of eye services for patients of any age. Dr. Susan H. Eiland, M.D., PC has practiced in Birmingham for over 30 years and is an expert in cataract and refractive surgery. Dr. Susan H. Eiland performs a comprehensive array of services including treatment of cataract, glaucoma, macular degeneration, diabetic eye disease and eyelid problems. The office is conveniently located near at 2700 10th ave South Building #2 Suite 404 Birmingham AL. 35205. Accessable parking is available.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

VisionAmerica of Birmingham is a full-service ophthalmology practice that specializes in Lasik and laser vision correction. The center offers treatment for several refractive errors, such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, astigmatism and presbyopia. Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

VisionAmerica of Birmingham is a full-service ophthalmology practice that specializes in Lasik and laser vision correction. Its physicians specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases, such as cataract, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy and retina-related disorders. The center also offers refractive surgery solutions and laser eye surgery, as well as provides vision care, general and pediatric ophthalmology services and cataract surgery. Its staff includes surgeons and specialists. VisionAmerica of Birmingham also performs eye examination for adults and children. The center offers treatment for several refractive errors, such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, astigmatism and presbyopia. Maintaining a location in Birmingham, Ala., VisionAmerica of Birmingham is a part of Eye Health Partners, which operates throughout Alabama and Tennessee.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.
